comment: Hot on the toung, evaporates off the pallet, sweet, peppery, charred

What a wonderful bottle! Strong scent of alcohol lingers from nose all the way throughout the finish. Pour a few drops of water to open this whiskey all the way up and let the wood sink into your tastebuds

Absolutely needed an ice cube to bring out the flavor and curb some of the punch.
Rich tasting bourbon with almost fruity undertones, I even got a hint of some chocolate!
Would recommend again, but beware, Stagg packs a punch.

My girlfriend scored a bottle of this for my birthday. Some of the best bourbon I have ever had. Tasted neat then added a bit of water and enjoyed for an hour. Got better the longer it sat out. Going to save this for special occasions and close friends.
What a fabulous treat. The heat is comforting and makes my head swim! I love this Bourbon!
Had some in Las Vegas. Smells like pure sweet honey, caramel, spice, mild burn but good. Ten minutes into sipping my lips got numb. Sweet, think, spices and great long finish. It's a sipper .

Sad to say I was unable to drink it without water but after adding a fare amount I could give this juice it's deserved justice. Old leather almost dusty in flavor with notes of salted chocolate and oak. I have trouble getting most of the fruit notes. I may be rusty but i was not impressed at first but it grew on me as I had more.

Probably my favorite GTS release. Huge bourbon...tons of caramel and vanilla with a dark chocolate undertone that fades to tobacco. Try it neat to get the full experience, but it can handle a add splash of water. Goes perfectly with a light, creamy cigar
Best bourbon I've ever had. Add an ice cube and the sweetness really comes out.

One of the best.  The flavor profile listed on Distiller doesn't appear to be very accurate as I found this bottling to be extremely oily when compared to the 2013 and 2017.  Much better than the 2013 also.

Whewwwww this one I tried Omar a tasting blind and I knew it was hottttr! A few drops of water maybe three added to the heavy pour and wow the complexity is unreal! So much going on and the finish Just hugs your tongue till the end I wish I had a whole bottle!

Peppered corned beef on the nose. Initial taste feels like you accidentally touched your tongue to a car battery. That must be the 140+ proof. But let this sucker sit for 5 minutes or add a drop of limestone water and you have the best bourbon I've ever had.
sweet caramel, light cherry and other red fruit
Better than the 13. Much better nose. Still not fantastic
Strong neat. Flavor changes dramatically with ice (good)

Best bourbon I've ever had. Not really a bourbon fan but this I'd love to have a bottle of. At around $800USD on the secondary market not a chance that'll ever happen though.  I was fortunate to spot a  an opportunity to taste an open bottle. Beautifully rich complex and amazing easy to drink neat at nearly 70% abv

Update: I got to try this again years with a lot more experience under my belt and not surprisingly the score has dropped to 4.25. Great dram but not quite the dizzying heights it reached before.

Best bourbon I’ve had...the hype is real 

Heat with flavor, so well balanced

95.5/100*

*I rank my whiskey based on a 100 point scale. It is a cumulative score with each category of nose, taste, finish, and balance worth up to 25 points. Here is how this score translates to the number of stars I give:

0 stars = 50 or below
1 star = 60
2 stars = 70
3 stars = 80
4 stars = 90
5 stars = 100

The score is rounded to the closest 1/4 star increment.
Hot spice wrapping dark fruits, musty barrel, lumberjack strong. Longer finish than a tie basketball game.

Hard to say what's better between this and my ECBP Batch 10. I will have to open a fresh bottle of each to do a SBS and find out. Either way, one of them is the best bourbon I've ever tasted and I have them both!
